website_summaries.verdict: The Camco RV cover is durable in colder climates and resistant to rainfall and snow.
pros: Triple-layer SFS top panel beads water on contact, providing max resistance to rainfall and snow
Heavy-duty integrated zippers allow easy access to doors and storage with cover in place
cons: Vents and satellite dishes can make sizing a challenge

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrates after a year
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 of these and they last about 14 months before disintegrating. They look good for 12 months, but then rapidly go downhill to near dust a few months after that. This happens without taking it on or off, just sitting there. The Camco warranty says 2 years, but only the first year is 100% the second year is pro-rated based on full MSRP. So the warranty is essentially worthless after the first year, which amazingly they have perfected the product to survive at least that long. I live in California where the sun is rather intense, so your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: AxonMisfire

customer_reviews.title: Bad product and support
customer_reviews.text: After a year and a half, there are tears in many places including a major hole in the front. I filed an online claim and received no response. I followed up with second claim copying Amazon and received no word from either parties. I've read other folks expressing similar complaints, especially regarding the paper like membrane on top. The material seems to disintegrate like paper would when exposed to the weather, April 15, 2017: Once again, I have sent Camco and Amazon a copy of the original claim with no response. I'm losing faith in Amazon and will never buy anything from Camco. They appear to be plain dishonest
customer_reviews.author: Gary S Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.  Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this cover with my wife. The instructions were OK but I'm not sure how they could be made better. The cover seems well made though I think it's a little over sized for what they tell you. I bought the 30-32 foot cover for a 30 foot motor home and there is about four extra feet of length. The tie downs seem good...kind of a funky system and they should have included nylon cinch fittings for the sides. Probably the best thing I could say about it is that my wife and I installed it in about 40 minutes...start to finish. No sniping. No yelling. Considering how hard I can be to work with, that says a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Wight Mann

customer_reviews.title: Not recommeded
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 10 months. The strap fasteners are dumb — hard to adjust and the ends are a simple plastic-coated u-shaped hook. The cloth straps stretch easily and the end hooks pop off, especially when it is windy. By the time I realized part had come loose, it had flapped itself crazy causing rips. Tried tying them down and that worked for a while. Unfortunately the Arizona sun did its thing on the fabric after just a couple months and the whole thing deteriorated and then fell apart in another dust storm.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Orr

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrating after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: This started out well. It covered the camper nicely. But now, 1 year later, it's disintegrating. My husband has patched the holes with duct tape for now but we'll have to replace it before winter. Yes, we're at 6,000' but this is supposed to be used outdoors so I don't think that's a good excuse for falling apart. Very, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Krische

customer_reviews.title: Works great on a 36' car hauler
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for my 36' gooseneck car hauler. Was easy to install and the adjustable skirt strapped worked great for attaching to the undercarriage of my trailer. I installed this cover by myself and was simple once I found the front and back tags, just payed the cover out on the roof and unfurled the sides to fall down the edges. Will update my review after this incoming Minnesota winter, hopefully it remains water tight.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Falling Apart After Just 2 Winters !
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Camco cover for our 5th wheel camper in August of 2017. We've used it just 2 Winters - and not particularly hard Winters. And as you can see from the photos, its falling apart. The tears aren't on any sharp objects or sharp corners. The one photo shows the material is tearing away from a zipper. I sent my review, and expressed my dissatisfaction directly to Camco via their "Contact" page on the Camco web site. I never got any response from them. So clearly, they do not care ! I will never again buy this brand of cover.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Lagrange

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cover last fall for a 32' 5th wheel. After reading reviews from 1 to 5 I thought I'd give my thoughts. I just removed it after a long winter in Northern Mi. It survived over 130" of snow and the normal high winds off Lake Michigan with no issues. I did the tennis ball over all the down spouts for cover protection. The only problem I really see is after reading reviews it seemed that the cover ran a little small so I bought the 32-34' for my 32' and it was actually big. The side material is thin as allot commented but if you don't get rough with it I think you'll be fine
customer_reviews.author: Markspm

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory
customer_reviews.text: This would have been my 3rd winter using the cover. The first year it weathered alright. 2nd winter it really started showing its age. At that point I should have contacted the vendor. The material was starting to wear and get some holes. This year put it on and we had some strong winds and it ripped wide open. The cover is now laying on the ground. Now I understand why there is a 2 year warranty. That is how long it lasts. Also as a side note... The included tire covers are not even large enough to cover the tires on my boat, let alone a 30' camper toy hauler.
customer_reviews.author: Hil Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cover for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to cover a 2018 Rockwood camper trailer and this product covers the trailer from spare tire to the propane tanks (inclusive). The trailer manufacturer recommends a vented cover, and this cover is well ventilated. It is made of quality material and is easy to deploy. The only problem is that I had to find another way of attaching it in that the supplied attachments would not work on this particular trailer. In spite of that I would purchase this again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Torn strap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our fifth wheel and was pleased until we put it on and saw there was a strap needed to secure the side torn off, I bought “new” to avoid this type of problem but after the entire fifth wheel was covered we discovered this so my husband figured out a way to make it work using other materials. We won’t buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am not at all happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am not at all happy with this product. We put the product on just like the video I found online. Seemed like it was going to be good although I did think it was a bit thinner than I expected. Fast forward a couple months and there are several holes. Big holes just from the wind and other holes where the ladder is on the trailer. I wish they would of made mention of the fact that we should put something under the tarp at the ladder or it would rip. It was basically a wast of almost $300, I will come back and add pictures soon. Terrible!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi S.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: When putting this on our trailer one of the top straps ripped off when tightening it down. And when we grabbed the side to straighten the cover over the top it ripped a huge hole in it. Product material reminds me of disposable kitchen towels. Since our trailer is in the mountains 2 hours away from our home we left it on the trailer because something is better than nothing. The shape and size of the cover is great, it’s the material that is a disapointment . I sure hope it protects our trailer from the snow and rain this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Too Small for 42 foot cyclone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cover for my cyclone 41.7 foot abs the cover is 2 foot short !!! I traveled 3 hours to get to my 5th wheel to find the cover will not fit after 2 hours of trying .! As I will not have a chance to go back to the RV until spring I had to make it work by opening the rear zips using ropes secure the cover .. Not happy that it said it will fit a 42 foot !! Maybe a 39 foot cyclone not a 41.7 foot RV I hate it when your told something and it's not correct and I waisted my time and money .
customer_reviews.author: Tracey B.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: It went on surprisingly easy. I like the fact that they have the front and back marked. It’s too early to tell how the cover will wear. It seems rugged enough. I gave it 4 stars because the zippers are hard to use in the cold. If anyone has a suggestion on a good way to lubricate them, I’d appreciate your suggestions. They’re plastic and not metal. Im worried about breaking them.
customer_reviews.author: Bob T.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped the snow from resting on the surface and rusting!
customer_reviews.text: Got this just in time before we had some major snow here. Works very well and no moitsure seeped through! Which is exactly what I needed! Was easy to put on and now I we have more space in our converted garage since we can safely store our pop-up outside of it.
customer_reviews.author: David Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last two years.
customer_reviews.text: I used the 10'-12' cover for my pop-up camper, and it has come completely apart over the last couple weeks. I bought it in March 2015, and it's February 2017, so it *almost* made it a full two years. But I am unhappy with its durability. I live in Colorado, and my camper sits under a tree and is relatively protected from the elements. But it's coming apart on every edge, as though the fibers hit an expiration point and gave up simultaneously. I'll be looking for an alternative for the next cover.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Mine lasted 4 years
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd cover that I am burying. They seem to last about 4 years were I live in north Alabama. I will look at installing a metal carport when this one is no longer effective. I think the metal airport will be a better solution to my storage needs but until then this will do.
customer_reviews.author: MJvR

customer_reviews.title: The method of attaching to trailer does not work very ...
customer_reviews.text: The method of attaching to trailer does not work very well. Adco has straps that go from one side to the other. I've only had this cover 2 months and has two rips already. 11/06/17 Update: cover has now ripped 3 feet and the rip is not a seam but the material itself has ripped. The cover at this location is not even tight, so it was not even under strain.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: I should have expected this result as several straps ripped off very easily. The cover split at the front of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an update. This cover did not last one season in Michigan. It ripped after four months. When I was putting it on, I should have expected this result as several straps ripped off very easily. The cover split at the front of the motorhome from the top across to both sides. When I took it off, much of the material was frayed. Save you money or spend more to get a quality product that will last.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN A. MCLEAN

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well to winter snow and wind
customer_reviews.text: This is our first snowy winter with the trailer cover and it seems to be holding up well. It is well vented to reduce in moisture around the trailer. The straps work well to keep it from blowing around in heavy wind. Overall we are very happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.author: D. Bozarth

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this RV cover as a cheap option compared to the offerings at local camper supply stores..expensive mistake. After one winter this cover had caused discoloration to both of my awnings and tore my roof membrane where the hold down straps extend from the top of the cover. As a result my entire roof has to be replaced and I am opting to replace both awnings. I would highly discourage anyone from purchasing this RV cover.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 1

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, wind and a blowing rain shredded this cover!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cover because "CAMCO" was the recommended cover. I carefully covered my 5th wheel, and placed padding anywhere that I anticipated wear might occur. That was in late October, the first week in April, I came back to discover the shredded cover and ripped loose tie downs. I pressed my finger on a rather tight spot that occured during the shredding, and my finger went right through! Dont waste your time with CAMCO covers. I am currently working with Amazon to recover some of my loss. HAPPY CAMPING
customer_reviews.author: Joanne M.

customer_reviews.title: This has been the biggest disappointment. Used it for one winter and put it ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been the biggest disappointment. Used it for one winter and put it back in the bag for dry storage indoors. Got it out this year and I cant hardly touch it without tearing... Getting ready to purchase a cover for my new 40' fifth wheel. Definitely wont be buying this cover..
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Please don't make the same mistake I did; this item is absolute garbage! I purchased this cover in November of 2016 and installed it the week of Thanksgiving. It was difficult to roll out and I knew immediately that I had made a mistake in buying it. The fabric is FLIMSY and tears with the slightest pressure. The first time we had a storm where there was wind the cover literally disintegrated. I'm a long term Amazon customer and rarely write reviews but felt an obligation to warn potential customers about this item. It is a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: JHetrick

customer_reviews.title: I expect that it would be good for around 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Decent cover for the money. Install instructions didn't match how the cover was rolled and folded by manufacturers and made it difficult to initially put on. Need to be fairly strong to get on top of camper or have two people. Just got our 1st wear hole after 6 weeks on Ladder rung. I expect that it would be good for around 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paper thin cover made with cheap material
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! Fabric tears easy, very thin material, ripped on the smallest snag, couldn’t pull it hard for fear it would tear. Was going to send it back, but it caught on something and tore, so we patched it with the nice patch kit that was included. We have checked on the camper since we put the cover on and it has tears in other places now!! I Just purchased this cover not even 2 months ago in September. Out of the box it looks nice, but was folded backwards, so we had to unroll and flip it over. Now we have to buy another cover and it won’t be this brand. Very expensive Disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Lanette

customer_reviews.title: high quality top, good tie downs!
customer_reviews.text: Do not pull on the velcro tabs, they rip off very easy! Other than that, this is a great cover. It has held up this winter to some strong storms with a inch of rain in 24 hours and 50 mile a hour gusts. I am very happy with how water proof the top is. The sides are not as waterproof as the top but as long as there is not standing water on them the rain runs off well.
customer_reviews.author: US4

customer_reviews.title: 16'-18'. Just got delivered so I don't know yet ...
customer_reviews.text: 16'-18'. Just got delivered so I don't know yet how the material will hold up in the desert sun. I'll say the size is what I expected. Its bunched up in the front but I ordered it bigger to cover the battery and propane tank on my 17'2" pop-up. You tie the elatisized straps to the cover itself then bend the felt covered metal end to "hook" onto the bottom. Mine is flat under so "hooking" is harder. It has mesh panels under the flap. The back end has no strap but elastic grabs the tire. I'll see how it holds up to rain, wind, sun.....
customer_reviews.author: MamaRae

customer_reviews.title: Good cover but oversized for 1 21' or less trailer
customer_reviews.text: Ended up being significantly larger than my 19ft trailer. Would have liked an option to reduce the size with zippers or something. The quality however was good and the zippers they did provide made it easy to get in and out of the trailer without removing the cover. Also appreciated a bag that comfortably held the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Kotulak

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: We put this cover on our 23 foot travel trailer. We made sure that everything was well tucked in, all straps were tight, and nothing was flapping. Our winter winds are legendary, but we had everything snug and even used a couple extra straps to make sure everything was tight. The cover lasted two months before the winds ripped the straps and the metal hooks. The damage was too much to fix, and we had to trash the entire cover. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty boots

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: The cover was ripped out of the box on one of the velcro side pieces, which have absolutely no description for use in the documentation, which is lousy anyway. Overall, I expected much better. If it weren't so late in the season I would have bundled it back up and it back. As it is, I had to duct tape the rip. We'll see what they (company/Amazon) do to make it right.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Smith

customer_reviews.title: FLIMSY
customer_reviews.text: IN a WORD ►FLIMSY. . . the hold downs that are attached to the cover itself, then 'hook' on the underside of the RV don't HOLD. The attaching pint on the cover itself is WEAK and won't stand up to any tension. One came off while installing the cover with very little stress. Two weeks ago we had some wind and three came off on the other side. Our RV is in a walled area with RV's parked on both sides, Wind gusts were up to 35 MPH. Since there had been wind, the WARRANTY was NUL and VOID
customer_reviews.author: KZ Mike

customer_reviews.title: Total failure in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought in October 2016 for the up-coming winter season. Installed on our RV in November 2016. The specifications state a two year warranty. As of mid February 2017 the top has shredded in about 3 months. The specs said the top is triple layered but the shredded top shows only one layer. Not good for any weather condition and if I can figure out who to contact I'll ask for a full refund. There was no Warranty info or contact information in the box. I would not recommend this RV cover and at this point a total waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Gough

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a year with sun and weather....
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a year, but it became very brittle (nearly like cardstock paper) after being in the sun everyday, storms, and snow. Also didn’t seem to do very well in the wind, there were times the whole side of my trailer was exposed and the cover was barely hanging on in strong winds. Which required me to pull the cover down from time to time, not a big deal but worth mentioning. It was inexpensive, but not really built to last from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Flamm368

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Forest River Rockwood HW A-Frame Popup Camper (A214HW).
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit for my High Wall popup Aframe Trailer. Not too tight but you need to take your time putting it on or it seems like you could rip it. VERY happy with the side and top fit. Fits my Forest River Rockwood HW A-Frame Popup Camper (A214HW) better than I expected. Only Problem is there is no lip under my camper so the clips that hold the sides down don't really work on my camper very well. Going to have to put hooks underneath and get bungee's to hold it down.
customer_reviews.author: Dean M. Herman

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but
customer_reviews.text: The material looks good coming out of the box, but if you even lightly pull on it or if the wind blows it will rip at the corners. The overall design is quite functional, I would just suggest you predetermine all corners and edges before first use and reinforced with a heavier duty material than the patches provided.
customer_reviews.author: Les Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Fit was good, although an extra couple inches of width would ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit was good, although an extra couple inches of width would have been nice. I bought the 32' to 34' model for my 31'10" 5th wheel thinking the 30' to 32' may have been a bit tight. After installing this one I don't think it would have been. All in all, this one fits fine; plenty of hold down straps and it already survived a 30+ mph windstorm without issue. I bought this one because of prior experience with Camco covers and was very pleased to see the quality is still there. Thanks Camco!
customer_reviews.author: jw

customer_reviews.title: Fits Perfect and Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 38' cover for my 37' Montana with dual AC and the cover fits perfect. This is the first year to use the cover so not sure how waterproof it will actually be but for the price it seems to be well made!
customer_reviews.author: Stew

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, stores well in the bag however it ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, stores well in the bag however it only lasted 17 months. It is shot now. Holding it together with tape to try and get another few months out of it. The first rips and sun rot began to show up at about a year from purchase date.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: let it drape down over the sides and once its straight secure it with the supplied straps and it should be good to go
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well worth the price. Well made. Needs 2 people and a calm day when you put it on. Protect any sharp edges with a blanket and do not force, let it drape down over the sides and once its straight secure it with the supplied straps and it should be good to go. My rv is covered for 2 weeks and we have had some 30-40 mph winds and it is still in place the way I hoped it would be. No rips or tears yet. knock one wood. Yes I recommend it based on my experience so far.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Virant

customer_reviews.title: Fits a Coleman Westlake 2002 great ..
customer_reviews.text: Only had this s couple of weeks but fits the coleman Westlake 2002 really well hoping it will be a good cover will update if I can later on
customer_reviews.author: Larry Ledford

customer_reviews.title: Trying Again to find a good Pop-up Cover
customer_reviews.text: I hope this time that a cover lasts for my pop-up without shredding during the first winter of use. I previously owned two different covers from a competing company with a good reputation. Both were shredded by typical windy days from late fall thru early spring here in upstate New York. The last one had a white teflon-like coating that totally disintegrated. I like the tie down system on this cover. As previous customers have noted, the covers run large, so I did not get the next larger size. I am glad that I did. The cover is only about 2 inches longer and wider than the trailer, so it fits well. The fabric also seems stronger. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Really Works
customer_reviews.text: This is our second attempt at a cover. We have the trailer stored in a fairly windy area south of Denver, Co, and the first cover was ripped to shreds in two months (a different brand.) This one has a different design that I have not quite figured out. It is roomier -- but designed to be .. The straps tie down vertically under your trailer at four spots on each side.. And the result is that the cover is not all that tight. But somehow this looser fit seems to work better and air / wind move through it better without ripping the cover. I'll update after this season. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Dry Rotted and Ripped
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and looked nice. Dry rotted and ripped a little over a year after purchase. Requested warranty with no response on the first request. Requested again and was told I would have to pay 50% of the new price plus $25 shipping. Not worth it! I will look for a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: ScullyDog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is working good. I had some difficulty figuring out the straps but thanks to YouTube it's all good. Well its been a couple months since I installed the cover. I went to check it out after a wind and snow storm. The cover was still connected and strapped but it was torn down the middle on top and hanging down. I am not happy with that. Now I need another new one and don't know which one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Jack King

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camper Cover
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome cover. Excellent material and great detailing for a sure fit. Even though camper was stored indoors over winter, this protected from leaky roof and should offer many years of good performance. Sizing seems to be confusing for some. I have an Aliner Classic -- 12' box with 3' hitch. Went with 12'-14' cover size and it's perfect to generously cover entire unit AND the LP tank in front.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee

customer_reviews.title: Not as long as everyone says!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 12-14 ft cover and kept it in my garage for the ultimate destruction of my old cover. Finally brought it out for my 12 ft Jayco with storage box (1998). Not quite long enough for my Jayco. Now, I admit, the Jayco is a big trailer. And the storage box up front makes it even bigger. But next time I will buy the 14-16 foot. I kept this one too long and am stuck with it but it does not quite cover the box of the trailer... never mind the propane tank and battery. Bottom line, I will buy the 14-16 foot one next time. Read that to say it is nicely made trailer cover of superior materials.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts 2-4 years depending on weather
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our Coleman pop up camper in 2014. It fit well and we were originally happy with it, however after two years I noticed a random rip in the front section. Soon after that the material literally started ripping randomly. By year 3, the ripping was much worst; the material was so delicate it could literally be ripped like a paper towel. We have a lot of rain and some snow here in the pacific northwest but that is what this cover should be designed for. For the price I expected the cover to last at least 5 years without any major issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor product or defect?
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this cover back in October and just unpacked it last week to install on my camper. I don’t know what changed from identical previous cover to this one but just light handling and one of the side seams came in stitched and now has a foot and half gash down the side. The last Camco cover lasted three years before it needed to be replaced, which is understandable due to weather and so on.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Plourde

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, used one two years and it provided ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, used one two years and it provided my motor home with great protection. Like the multiple zipper access so I can still get to various doors, storage, etc during winter. Hold down straps keep it in place even in high winds.
customer_reviews.author: David Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This does not fit my 35 foot motor home. The roof is not wide enough, so one side is about 4-5 feet too short. The front and back are too long. Had very hard time putting it on. My husband hates it, says it should not get any stars. The material is not very thick. Already had a cut in the front side.
customer_reviews.author: Cubby

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews we decided to purchase this cover. Was fairly easy to install yet the fabric seemed a like fragile felt, so was very concerned. It did catch it a couple of areas and tore slightly, which must be common because it came with large patch pieces! We just had some very windy days here in So Cal, and the cover survived great! So far, impressed that it is doing what we were looking for. Suggest purchasing wheel covers as well because the cover isn't long enough to cover the tires as shown in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: lvmpnda

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for my 14.25' folding trailer
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2013 Aliner Expedition folding aframe style trailer. Box size is 7ft wide by 14.25ft long with an AC sticking out the side. Ordered the 12-14ft version after reading that the sizes run large, and I can say this fit like a glove. On a 12 foot box, I think this would be way too big. Nice design, and the tie downs seem good, though with the way the tie downs hook under the frame, I do wonder if I'll be looking for my cover down the road if a big wind storm hits. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: paul2earth

customer_reviews.title: Generous size, Good Quality material
customer_reviews.text: Generous fit, material seems to be excellent quality. This cover has the extra rain protection on top, with vented sides to prevent moisture buildup under the cover. We live in California where (sadly) lots of rain is not a problem for us. Instead, we are looking for protection from intense sun. We just put the cover on, so I cannot attest to it's long term use; however, it fit easily and has plenty of tie down straps if you live in a windy area or are storing it long term.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin W

customer_reviews.title: The tie downs were the best I have ever had or a cover
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were a little different than the way the cover unfolded, but got through it. The tie downs were the best I have ever had or a cover. The quality of the cover seems to be as desribed. Just make sure you cover any sharp objects (rotatiing vents, low profile antennas, ect.). I think this one will last. Good warranty. Hope I don't have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Janie Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Well made and fit is good.
customer_reviews.text: Our cover arrived on time and we installed it on Friday. It is hefty weighing in at about 60lbs. We covered a 38 foot long Cedar Creek and all went well. The front and rear of the cover is clearly marked to help you with orientation. The cover has lots of zippers too if you need to access the storage doors or the main entry. I like the strap systems design and the bungee cords provided to secure the cover. We felt the price was fair and know we got our money’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Biggest piece of garbage we have ever purchased. It was torn right out of the box and tore repeatedly and very easily as we were trying to put it on! Unfortunately, we bought it in July and tried to put it on in December, so now we are out $250+!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are absolutely useless..
customer_reviews.text: 28' cover Didn't fit my 27' trailer, too short by 3'. Fabric is very thin and ripped when unpacking it, so I can't return it. Instructions are absolutely useless... it's not folded even close to what it says in the manual and the front and rear tags are buried in the fold.
customer_reviews.author: Mark a.

customer_reviews.title: For the money, the fabric makes this not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is flimsy. one of the velcro straps ripped off from just adjusting the fabric, not even pulling hard. We made sure to cover all sharp objects, but unless you wrap your RV in bubble wrap, good luck! We are going to try some iron-on patches where the fabric ripped and will follow-up again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cover for a 2000 Coleman Fleetwood Niagara because I was looking for something better than the heavy duty tarp I was using. I am very pleased with the quality of the cover. I think they might be made a little on the large side (my box is 15') and the cover fits over my gas bottle with room to spare. That said, I would buy another one if needed and would also recommend this cover to anyone looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cover
customer_reviews.text: Protected the camper well the first season. Only issue a small tear near one of the Velcro tabs but it was low enough on the cover that it did not hurt anything. Hoping that it does as well this season
customer_reviews.author: Dyoungbluth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cover
customer_reviews.text: For the money, you can't beat this cover! I have a 2007 Rockwood 2405SS with a 12' box, ordered the 14-16' cover and it fit perfectly...large enough to cover the spare tire, the front storage box, and the front propane tank! I didn't use the tiedowns that were included. I just tied small diameter rope to each cover strap and tied it around frame members. That let me adjust the fit evenly...easy to tie and easy to remove. I have only been using it for about 2 months, but no sign of mold on the camper since it has nice vents. Could not be happier with the cover so far.
customer_reviews.author: LakeLady

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.text: This cover fits our R.V. perfectly! We have had several days of strong winds and the cover remained in place with no damage. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hippy Chick

customer_reviews.title: Cover is disintegrating after two years
customer_reviews.text: The cover seemed well-made and durable when we originally bought it, but now two years later it's falling apart. It started with a few small tears, but soon those small tears became huge rips, and when we removed the cover this week sections of the material were left on the camper. Perhaps this cover can only be used in an enclosed space? Definitely not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1st one lasted less than 2 years in south Mississippi sun,; 2nd one lasted less than 4 months in a New York winter.
customer_reviews.text: dry rotted and tore apart in less than two years in southern Mississippi sun. Not a good choice for direct sun for long periods. Other than that, the cover was large and easy to put on and off and had a great securing system. Bought a second unit and installed in South West New York in November. This too has started to tear and rip apart after only 4 months. Now I have to see if they will honor the two year warranty. Apparently these things do not weather good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: cover is fine but I received a cover for a 40' fifth ...
customer_reviews.text: cover is fine but I received a cover for a 40' fifth wheel trailer. Needless to say I had a lot of extra length on my 30' trailer. I ordered a size up to a 32' trailer. Used it anyway but took three people to install and extra rope to secure extra cover. Would have sent back but needed cover sooner not later.
customer_reviews.author: youngr

customer_reviews.title: Great cover! Looked easy to put on. Has held up for 6 years!
customer_reviews.text: Great cover! Looked easy to put on...my brother and nephew put it on for me! Great water proof with the rain and snow we got. Easy access to the camper if you need to get in after the cover is on. I've had the cover since November 2013 and it has lasted. Has gotten some rips and tears in it thru the years, but a little patching has kept the cover for using. Going to buy a new one for 2020 season and hope it will last as long ad this one has.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Get a better cover if that is your intent
customer_reviews.text: Covers well, roof is okay but the sidewalls are thin enough to see right through. I would not use it for harsh winter weather storage in the north. Get a better cover if that is your intent. Other than that it's a decent cover.
customer_reviews.author: cruellatk

customer_reviews.title: I like the cover however
customer_reviews.text: The stitching on the cover started to tear in one of the corners after only a few months. That should not happen with a cover that costs this much. As of right now I don't even know if there is a warranty, but I am trying to find out. In my opinion, since I haven't even owned it a year and the stitching started to tear after a few months I should get a new cover. We'll see what happens but I am not optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: The cover seems to be good. However the hooks need to be different in ...
customer_reviews.text: The cover seems to be good. However the hooks need to be different in the way they hook under the fifthwheel. They hook only on the metal of the underneath edge and I was afraid that they would bend the metal. I ended up taking a bunge and hooking it from one side to the other of the trailer. I also added a rope all the way around the perimeter of the trailer and then added 2 more ropes all the way around the cover at the ac unit and back by the rear roof vent to keep the wind from getting under the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Good Design/Extremely Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in May, 2015, lasted less than a year. I will give credit to the design of the cover as it enables access to doors and storage compartments with minimal headache. Material quality - is another matter. The quality of material is fine for protecting your RV against the elements but it will not tolerate ANY mishandling - the material will rip/tear fast (and often) and the supplied patch kit is completely worthless. I recommend investing more dollars on a better grade cover (not from Camco) - which I have the pleasure of doing now. Have historically had excellent luck with Camco products but they only hit the 50% mark on this product.
customer_reviews.author: DKE

customer_reviews.title: Camco 5th Wheel Cover
customer_reviews.text: Covering 8244S 27' 5th Wheel. Wanted to see how it held up for it's first Minnesota Winter, did great and is in good shape. Make sure you cover up any corners that can rub against the cover from the wind because it will cause a hole. I did not put enough padding on a corner and I have a 1" by1" worn spot, no big deal I'll just gate a patch. The cover took a good beating from the wind and snow.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Need instructions with purchase
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if installation instructions were included with the purchase. Good thing UTibe has some videos.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy it portrayed.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, watched the video and read the directions and it was not that easy to install. At first appearance it looked high quality. However, Ripped a hole in it pulling on a strap and got a fat lip when another strap broke while trying to pull it into position. Hoping it last this winter and several more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not great for fifth wheels...
customer_reviews.text: this thing was a beast to install. The description indicated it would work with a fifth wheel and I assumed it was made for a fifth wheel. WRONG. It's "universal". It took my husband and I two hours to put this thing on. We had to monkey around with the straps on the front. The fifth wheel pictured looks so neat and orderly. Ours looks like a three year old did it. We had to gather all the excess material and use bungee straps to hold it. All in all the quality appears to be as described.
customer_reviews.author: Lindarelle

customer_reviews.title: This cover I thought was good quality at first
customer_reviews.text: This cover I thought was good quality at first. It lasted a little over a year I took it off once to fix the small rips made by the rain gutters it seemed to do well after that until a few days ago it ripped around the air conditioner then after some wind it finished ripping all the way down the center and is now on the ground. So I gave it 3 stars it's great for short term use just not long term.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi Rose

customer_reviews.title: easy on
customer_reviews.text: This cover was easy to put on our 32' motorhome. The tie downs seem very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Salvo

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how it will hold up installed seems to tear very easy I bought on bumper and ripped
customer_reviews.author: brian fleck

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality and excellent fit.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. Strong quality material. Excellent clipping system that is easily customized to fit different campers. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amberdrake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cover
customer_reviews.text: This camper cover fit our Aliner camper perfectly. It has been great during the winter to keep the snow off of it. It also helps prevent sun damage. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the bungee cords to hold to cover in place do not attach well. We ended up using a tie-down strap to wrap around the belly of the camper so that the wind will not blow it off. I would recommend finding a better way to secure the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Obara

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this despite many reviews stating hold down clips come loose. After installing on our 35' camper by myself (took about 30 min) I was impressed to see that the hold down straps work great. Anyone who can't figure this system out should not be allowed to walk and chew gum at the same time. The bottom connection to the trailer is a fabric wrapped metal strap that is very bendable. You simply bend into a fish hook profile and hook around the bottom part of your trailer. Ours held tight through the entire UP MI winter with several high wind episodes. This spring it looks brand new still. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made Pop-up cover
customer_reviews.text: Cover seems very well-made. The tiedown straps took a little bit of figuring, but seem to work well once you get the hang of it. The fit was pretty tight on my Jayco 10X with air conditioner, but I knew it might be and opted for a tighter fit as opposed to looser... I slit foam plumbing pipe insulation for corner protection to avoid where in tear through, and thus far all seems well. UV rays in the Texas summer will be the ultimate test for long-term durability...
customer_reviews.author: C. Rasure

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2001 Colemen Redwood like a glove. Has just enough extra at the front to cover the propane tanks and the level/crank. We'll see how well it holds up after a summer in the Arizona sun, but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: MikeInAZ

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: wont know until spring, Not the easiest to install, highly recommend 2 people. this cover has a lot of nice features for securing, compared to other covers that I have purchased this cover is far better. Could have come with instructions , but after trial and error its a nice secure fit.
customer_reviews.author: D. jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, better ordering information needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Jayco fold down camper, model 1207, but the box is actually almost 13 feet at the longest point. I read a lot of the reviews about this cover, and I was sure this size would fit my camper, I was wrong. I returned the cover for the next larger size, 12'-14', and it works great. The cover is well made and of good quality material, I especially like the breath-ability of the cover. Camco should give maximum length dimensions for each size cover, that would make ordering the correct size much easier. All in all, it is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: sparkymark

customer_reviews.title: Travel trailer cover
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and the material seemed durable
customer_reviews.author: rekd

customer_reviews.title: This product TOTALLY SUCK!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this cover is is not durable at all. I put the cover on my RV and and within 2 weeks it was already tearing. The tie down straps are not strong enough. The wind was only blowing like 10 mph and the straps busted and tore the cover from where they were being braced from. On the add it says that the cover is triple layered and durable, well its not at all and i paid 300 dollars for it and they wont let me return it. Do not buy this cover!!! the material is not good quality at all. I will never buy anything else from this place again, or Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Made from good material and OK fit (rather large.) Couple negatives- during the summer when it is hot, the cover "melts" onto the corners of the camper. Then you have to peel it off and this can cause tears in the cover. Also, the clips to hold cover down never stay- one small breeze and they come undone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: I had bought Adco covers in the past, this is by far the best cover, I put it on in the winter time to keep snow off.
customer_reviews.author: Johnn Engberson

customer_reviews.title: Good for only one year
customer_reviews.text: Just over a year old and it's going to pieces. Millions of little shards of the material, plus places where it hung on the edge of the trailer top are badly frayed (and it was not weighted down). Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Fenner

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This cover is garbage. A plastic garbage bag would be more durable. This is made of thin fabric similar to a surgical hat a patient would wear into surgery. I returned this item after about a week when the entire side ripped by the front Velcro seam during a very mild wind storm. I would not encourage anyone to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Ami Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 3 months of use and it’s ripping already. Don’t waste your money. I took all the precautions, wrapped all corners with bath towels etc. It’s a piece of junk at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Diesel

customer_reviews.title: NOT HEAVY DUTY & WON'T LAST FOR THE WARRANTY TERM
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I purchased this 3/2017 and now 7/2018 the material has come apart and it tears along the seem. I would only recommend this if you have an RV carport (So that it's not exposed to the sun) AND you only plan on having it installed intermittently...not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Product fit.
customer_reviews.text: The product fit. I ordered the one for a 30-32’ fifth wheel. Mine is a 31’. It was a little tight, but my trailer is a widebody. So far, everything seems fine. Durability and water protection are an unknown at this time. It has only been 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: robert johnson

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy this again or recommend it, it just doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Its ok quality of material but it doesn't do its job. The way the vent system is up top allows for the wind to blow it over allowing holes all across the top to allow water in. I would not buy this again or recommend it, it just doesn't work. I prefer the Adco design. Within just a couple of days is already has holes worn through it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: cover
customer_reviews.text: started tearing easily with one year and disenegrating with in 2 years
customer_reviews.author: k hgr

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. We'll see how it lasts
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We'll see how it lasts. Seems to stay in place well even in high winds. I think (hope) it will wear well because the fit and tie downs keep it from moving. Movement is what causes the fabric to wear thru anywhere it touches a protrusion like corners, gutters, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Old Handy Man

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: By the second season it became brittle and tore easily when taking off.
customer_reviews.author: William E White

customer_reviews.title: Superb ULTRAGuard Camper Cover
customer_reviews.text: I selected this camper cover based on the material used in it's construction; it is very similar to the material Coleman used many years ago on their pop-ups. I was not disappointed; the material is breathable yet repellant to water. Although it took me a little while to figure out the “tie-down” straps, it turns out their design is quite ingenious. Since covering the pop-up we’ve had several rain storms, many of them very windy. The cover stayed in place with ease. Very impressed with everything about this cover; will certainly keep this in mind when we upgrade to a larger RV. Russ
customer_reviews.author: F. Fortenberry

product_meta.title: Camco 45764 14'-16' ULTRAGuard Pop-Up Camper Cover (46"H x 87"W), Grey
product_meta.description:
Size:14' - 16'| Style:Pop-UpCamco 14'-16' ULTRAGuard RV Pop-Up Camper Cover is designed to protect your investment. It consists of a heavy-duty polypropylene fabric around the sides for additional protection. This cover also features triple layer SFS top panel construction ensuring maximum resistance to rainfall and snow. Engineered with vent flaps that reduce wind lofting. Storage bag is included.

AMAZON.COM


TRIPLE LAYER PROTECTION FOR YOUR POP-UP TRAILER
 Camco Ultraguard Pop-up Trailer Covers are designed to provide reliable protection for your trailer during storage. They feature a triple layer SFS top panel that beads water on contact, affording maximum resistance to rainfall and snow. They also utilize a heavy-duty polypropylene fabric around sides for maximum protection. Also featured are vented flaps that reduce wind lofting and inside moisture, that working together with a fully breathable design resists mold and mildew growth. Lastly Ultraguard Pop-up Trailer covers utilize an integrated self-adjusting hold down system that is guaranteed to keep your cover in place during winterization periods. 

Triple layer protection for pop-up trailers measuring between 6 to 18 feet in length.
View larger. High-tech breathable middle layer repels rain and snow while allowing trapped moisture to escape.
View larger. Measure to find the right cover for your needs SPECIFICATIONS
 The Camco line of Ultraguard Pop-up Trailer Covers is designed to provide a perfect fit for most any size of pop-up trailer currently available. See the full list of offerings available in this product line, including: product number, trailer length and cover dimensions. 

Camco Model # Trailer Length Cover Dimensions 45760 6-8'L 46"H x 87"W 45761 8-10'L 46"H x 87"W 45762 10-12'L 46"H x 87"W 45763 12-14'L 46"H x 87"W 45764 14-16'L 46"H x 87"W 45765 16-18'L 46"H x 87"W KEY FEATURES
 * Triple layer SFS top panel beads water on contact affording maximum resistance to rainfall and snow
 * Heavy-duty polypropylene fabric around sides
 * Vented design resists mold and mildew growth
 * Vent flaps reduce wind lofting and inside moisture
 * Tough interlocking seams
 * Storage bag included

TWO-YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY
 Camco Ultraguard Pop-up Trailer Covers carry a two-year limited warranty, applicable to the original purchaser when used under normal operating conditions. Proof of purchase is required. 

ABOUT CAMCO MANUFACTURING
Camco started in 1966 with one employee and one product. Today, over 40 years later, we have more than 350 employees, over 3,000 products and five manufacturing facilities to better serve our customers’ needs. Our home office is in Greensboro, North Carolina. We also have locations in Elkhart, Indiana; Portland, Oregon; Leominster, Massachusetts and our newest facility in Beilun, China.

Competitive pricing, superior service, quality products and customer satisfaction are the foundations upon which Camco operates. Our friendly, knowledgeable customer service staff stands ready to assist our customers with any questions. At Camco, we take pride in meeting the ever changing demands of a challenging marketplace while serving you, our most valuable asset.
feature_bullets: Triple layer SFS top panel beads water on contact providing maximum resistance to rainfall and snow
Heavy-duty polypropylene fabric sides and self-adjusting hold down strap system
Fits 14'-16' Pop-Up Camper and measures 46"H x 87"W
Vented flaps reduce wind lofting and inside moisture

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,448 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
